pyutil.mv_to_repo module¶

Moves files from anywhere in the home directory to the dotfiles repo.

This is a script I’ve been using for the better part of a year, so while the docstring formatting isn’t consistent and there are a couple odd sections, this script has served a very utilitiarian purpose.

May refactor one day. But it continues to work.

pyutil.mv_to_repo.backup_file(src)[source]¶

Backs up file ‘src’

pyutil.mv_to_repo.main()[source]¶

Dispatch the remaining implementation of the module.

Determine if a file name is in the current directory or absolute path. Then set up a relative path from $HOME. Use the root of the repo as the new root and move the file there, all while creating directories and backups.

Runs checks, calls func to backup file ‘src’, moves it to the dotfiles repo and symlinks it. Moves file to a hardcoded path but will be generalized to take as an argument.

Parameters:of file to backup, move and symlink. (Name) –
Assumes:
User runs the script from inside the folder of the file they want to move.
pyutil.mv_to_repo.repo_dir_check(dest)[source]¶

Checks that the directory is in the repository and make one otherwise.

pyutil.mv_to_repo.sys_checks()[source]¶

Checks that system requirements are met.
